Suffered A Head Injury? Watch For These Common Symptoms.

The public’s attentiveness to the seriousness of closed-head injuries (such as concussions or TBIs) and their long-term effects has become widespread in recent years. In the past, many thought that there wasn’t much to worry about with injuries to the head that did not result in bleeding, cuts, bruises or conspicuous wounds.

That way of thinking has changed. Closed-head injuries can be very serious and result in permanent brain damage that requires ongoing medical treatment and therapy.

Symptoms Of Brain Injuries

Individuals who have suffered head injuries and their family members should always be cognizant of symptoms like:

  • Headaches
  • Nausea
  • Dizziness
  • Slurred speech
  • Vomiting
  • Loss of consciousness
  • Poor concentration
  • Loss of memory or attention
  • Depression
  • Seizures
  • Tinnitus

If you see or experience any of the above, seek immediate medical attention.

Legal Help For Injuries Caused By Negligent Parties

If an injury was the result of negligence by another, discussing the matter with an attorney may allow you to obtain compensation for surgeries or other extensive medical care.

Decades Of Experience; Recognized By Peers For Outstanding Legal Efforts
